alert.note: Alert for Bland; Giles (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 4:20PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Giles and Bland Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 417 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated several clusters of thunderstorms with frequent cloud-to-ground lightning across much of Bland County extending into Western Giles County. Movement of the storms was south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Frequency Cloud-to-Ground Lightning. Very Heavy Rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Cloud-to-ground lightning is dangerous to people and property. Remain indoors if possible. Localized flooding is possible in areas of heavy rainfall. Locations impacted include... Bland... Bluefield... Rocky Gap... Bastian... Mechanicsburg... Clear Fork... and Chapel. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
